section.title: Overview
section.para: This formalism lean on the definition of two types of graphs: regulatory graphs which model regulatory networks, and state transition graphs which represent the dynamical behaviour, for given initial state(s) and under some updating assumptions.
GINsim is a computer tool implementing this formalism, see its tutorial or user manual for informations on GINsim.

biblioentry.title: Qualitative analysis of regulatory graphs: a computational tool based on a discrete formal framework
GINsim: a software suite for the qualitative modelling, simulation and analysis of regulatory networks

section.title: Nodes
section.para: Nodes are the main members of a regulatory network.

section.title: Interactions
section.para: Interactions between nodes are represented by edges in the regulatory graph.

section.title: Logical parameters
section.para: The Dynamic behavior of each node is control by logical parameters. These parameters define the state toward which a node tends for any state of his regulators.
